title: US military won't settle disputes if election results are contested, top general says
description: America's most senior general, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley, told members of Congress that the military will not play a role in November's election and won't help settle any disputes if the results are contested.

title: Sean Penn on Trump's Covid-19 response: When crisis comes to incompetence
description: Actor and activist Sean Penn talks to CNN's Anderson Cooper about life during the pandemic and his work on coronavirus testing in the US. Watch Anderson Cooper Full Circle every Monday, Tuesday, and Friday at 6p E.T.

title: See what happened when Trump crowd was asked to wear masks
description: Before President Trump's speech in New Hampshire, the crowd booed an announcement at the event asking the attendees to wear masks.

title: Trump's answer on what he would do in a second term is literally unintelligible
Jacob Blake no longer shackled to his hospital bed, attorney says
Trump pardons Alice Johnson
description: President Donald Trump granted Alice Marie Johnson a pardon on Friday, after commuting her prison sentence two years ago.

title: Blake's sister at March on Washington: 'Black America, I hold you accountable'
description: Fifty-seven years to the day Martin Luther King Jr. gave his "I Have a Dream" speech, relatives of African Americans killed in recent police shootings took to the same spot on the National Mall to emotionally call for social and political change.

title: Jacob Blake no longer shackled to hospital bed, attorney says
description: Jacob Blake was shot seven times in the back as an officer tried to detain him this week in Wisconsin. After he regained consciousness following the encounter that left him paralyzed, he turned to his father and wept.

title: Paradise islands reopen only to visitors who've had Covid-19
description: The turquoise waters and golden sand beaches of Brazil's Fernando de Noronha archipelago have reopened after being off-limits due to coronavirus, but authorities say its only accessible to those who have had Covid-19.

title: Man killed in Kenosha protests 'did a heroic thing,' girlfriend says
description: Anthony Huber was armed with nothing but his skateboard when he spotted an armed person among a crowded street in Kenosha, Wisconsin, but he still ran toward the danger, his girlfriend says.

title: Michelle Obama tweets about Kenosha shooting
description: Former first lady Michelle Obama said Friday she is "exhausted and frustrated" in a lengthy statement addressing the ongoing unrest in Kenosha, Wisconsin, after Jacob Blake was shot in the back seven times by police.

title: Hurricanes, fires, floods and locusts: Science says climate change is here but the RNC refuses to believe
description: The words "Biblical proportion" come to mind, but even the Plagues of Egypt didn't come all at once.

title: They bought a vacation home in Italy. Then Covid-19 shut it down
description: A second home in Italy? It's the dream. For married couple Marco Cavalli and Sunaina (known as Suni) Lobo of Oakland Hills, California, it became a reality over a year ago.

title: Andromeda galaxy's 'halo' is nudging the Milky Way
description: The Andromeda galaxy, our Milky Way galaxy's largest and nearest neighbor, is surrounded by a massive halo that is actually bumping up against our own galaxy's halo, according to new research using the Hubble Space Telescope.

title: US jets intercept Russian military aircraft off the Alaskan coast
description: US F-22 fighter jets intercepted Russian military aircraft in international airspace off the coast of Alaska late Thursday, according to North American Aerospace Defense Command.

title: Why does Walmart want TikTok? Look at how teens shop in China
description: Walmart is a 58-year-old American company known for big box stores that sell everyday goods, casual clothing, groceries and TVs.

title: Suspected poisoning of Putin critic was meant to kill him, not to scare him off, chief aide says
description: For years Leonid Volkov has experienced the same terrifying dream about his best friend and colleague, the leading Russian opposition activist Alexey Navalny.

title: Colbert sees endless possibilities for Melania's dress
description: Late-night comedian Stephen Colbert sounds off on President Donald Trump's speech during the final night of the Republican National Convention.

title: Mysterious 'bullet' plane is finally revealed
description: The whispers started three years ago.

title: Selena Gomez teams up with K-pop stars for 'Ice Cream'
description: After teasing fans with posters, snippets and stills for weeks, South Korean megaband Blackpink and American pop princess Selena Gomez unveiled their track "Ice Cream" on Friday. And in addition to the song's dangerously catchy, upbeat vibe, the accompanying video is a stylistic treat, too.

title: Colombia wants to resume spraying a toxic chemical to fight cocaine. Critics say it's too risky
description: Colombia wants to resume aerial spraying of a toxic chemical in remote rural areas to stop the growth of coca, the chief ingredient of cocaine -- despite stark health concerns.

title: Why damage from one of the most powerful storms to ever hit the US Gulf Coast was less than feared
description: Hurricane Laura is one of the most powerful storms ever to hit the US Gulf Coast, but its path avoided major cities such as Houston and New Orleans, causing less damage — to people and their towns — than initially feared.

title: Why Serena Williams may still have the edge at the US Open
description: For the last three years, Serena Williams has been chasing the all-time grand slam singles record of 24 championships held by Margaret Court.

title: Coronavirus model projects more than 317,000 US Covid-19 deaths by December
Boeing grounds eight 787 Dreamliners over manufacturing flaw
description: Boeing has found a problem with the manufacturing of the 787 Dreamliner, the widebody jet that is one of the most successful products of the troubled aircraft maker.

title: Banksy has bought a working refugee rescue boat (and sprayed it bright pink)
description: The British street artist Banksy has financed and decorated a bright pink rescue boat to help save the lives of migrants and refugees crossing the Mediterranean from North Africa to Europe.

title: Coronavirus model projects more than 317,000 US deaths by December
description: A well-known coronavirus model previously cited by the White House forecasts more than 317,000 US deaths from Covid-19 by December.

title: The week in 43 photos
description: Take a look at 43 photos of the week from August 20 through August 27.

title: Trump's answer on what he would do in a second term was unintelligible
description:
• Biden hits Trump where it hurts: in TV ratings
• Kanye's presidential bid unravels thanks to messy ballot access operation

title: The NBA took a stand against police violence. But a second message quickly became clear
description: When NBA teams elected to sit out Wednesday's slate of playoff games in a player-led protest of the police shooting of Jacob Blake, it set off a chain reaction unlike anything ever seen in American sports. Within hours, several MLB and MLS teams, led by their players, decided to pause the night's contests. The unprecedented stoppage stretched into a second day Thursday as more MLB teams postponed games. The WNBA, always at the forefront of sports activism, put a pause on their nascent season.

title: Coca-Cola cutting thousands of jobs as soda sales crater
description: Coca-Cola will cut thousands of jobs and reduce its number of business units as it faces declining beverage sales in the pandemic.

title: Blake's father: Jacob asked 'why did they shoot me so many times?'
description: Jacob Blake Sr. tells CNN's Alisyn Camerota about the conversation he had with his son in the hospital.

title: Japan's Abe resigns: 'I need to fight the disease'
Avlon: Contradictions in Trump's speech will give you whiplash
description: CNN's John Avlon looks at some of the contradicting claims President Trump made during his speech at the Republican National Convention.

title: Jacob Blake's father: We haven't heard from the White House
description: Jacob Blake's father says his family has not heard from the White House regarding his son's shooting, but that Democratic nominee Joe Biden and Kamala Harris reached out and spoke to him.

title: It's seen as one of the world's prettiest cities. But it was built on slavery and racism
description: Charleston, South Carolina, regularly is mentioned as one of the top cities in the world to visit, for many reasons: the natural, Lowcountry beauty and Spanish moss; its charm, sophistication and candy-colored houses angled toward the breeze; beaches and bottomless bowls of freshly trawled shrimp and stone-ground grits.

title: Japan's PM resigns, citing health reasons
description: • Abe's economic legacy will last for decades

title: Paralympic 'Rising Phoenix' Netflix documentary will make you laugh and cry
description: The Phoenix. It lives, dies and rises from the ashes to live again.

title: 'Airplane Mode': Quirky new video game lets you sit through a long-haul flight in economy class
description: What do you miss most about traveling? If you answered, "being stuck on a plane with crying babies while playing Sudoku," then this is the game for you.

title: Bright satellites in the thousands could impact future space discoveries
description: Large constellations of bright satellites in low-Earth orbit will "fundamentally change" astronomy that relies on ground-based telescopes -- and could even change the appearance of our night sky as viewed from Earth, according to a new report.

title: SoftBank gets even more defensive with new $14 billion asset sale
description: One of the world's biggest tech investors is raising billions more in cash by selling assets in a bid to protect itself from possible future waves of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: China wants Trump to stop 'scapegoating' Beijing. That seems unlikely
description: When it comes to the United States election, policymakers in China would rather their country was not a topic of conversation.

title: Late-night takes aim at RNC on final night
description: Late-night hosts James Corden, Trevor Noah and Stephen Colbert poked fun at some of big moments of the Republican National Convention.

title: Woman finds four snakes inside her blocked toilet tank
description: An Australian woman who had difficulty flushing her toilet was shocked to find four snakes coiled up inside the cistern.

title: Trump calls this the 'most important election in history'
description: President Donald Trump accepts the GOP's renomination for president in a speech held at the White House on the fourth night of the 2020 Republican National Convention.

title: Fact checker: This president is a serial liar
description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact checks President Donald Trump's speech at the fourth and final night of the 2020 Republican National Convention, where Trump officially accepted the Republican nomination for the upcoming presidential election.

title: Watch lightning strike as groom makes 2020 joke at wedding
description: Aaron and Denice Sawitsky got married in front of a small group of guests in Massachusetts, but not before lightning struck as the groom began to share his vows with the bride.

title: Reporter has close call with blast of electricity live on air
description: Hurricane Laura pushes around reporters covering the storm. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the wettest, wildest reporter moments.

title: The Democrats are making a case for Trump
description: A group of Democrats make the case for members of their party to back President Trump.
